title: Man accused of stalking woman, threatening her with a hammer
content: MANKATO — A Mankato man is accused of stalking and threatening a woman, burning her with a lighter and breaking into an apartment with a hammer.    Michael Charles Fox, 26, was charged Friday in Blue Earth County District Court with felony counts of burglary, threats and stalking and gross misdemeanor domestic assault.    A woman reported Fox was stalking her and got into her vehicle uninvited Thursday night and refused to get out. She said Fox then broke her cellphone and held the flame from a lighter to her shoulder. A police officer observed a burn mark on her shoulder, according to the criminal complaint.    The woman said she drove to a friend's apartment and Fox followed her inside and threatened to kill her. He reportedly left and came back with a hammer and kicked in the door.         The woman said he followed her to her car and made more threats as she left.
